net.coderazzi.filters.parser.generic
Interface IRelationalOperand

All Known Implementing Classes:
OperandFactory.ComparisonICaseOperand, OperandFactory.ComparisonOperand, StringWildcardOperand
public interface IRelationalOperand

Definition of a relational operand, as used in the FilterTextParser

An operand has the following features:

  • It is relational binary: it expresses a relational operation between two elements, whose results has a boolean type
  • It applies to specific types (classes)
  • It can require to be applied on the string representation of the objects, not the objects themselves

Author:
Luis M Pena - sen@coderazzi.net

Method Detail

symbolLength

int symbolLength()
Returns the length of the operand as a text symbol. Note that the interface does not preclude the need for the operand to know its string representation. In fact, this information is only required in the IRelationalOperandFactory

appliesOnType

boolean appliesOnType(Class<?> c)
Specific filter, to define on which types this operand applies.

stringBased

boolean stringBased()
If true, the operand applies on the string representation of the objects, not the objects themselves.

createOperator

IOperator createOperator(Object right)
Creates an operator by applying an object on an operand. For example, in 'a < 3', the operand is '<', and creates the operator '<3' when associated to the right object 3. Returns null if the right object is not valid.
